turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Gonium.
turn.2: Gonium  Gonium is a genus of colonial algae, a member of the order Chlamydomonadales.
turn.4: Typical colonies have 4 to 16 cells, all the same size, arranged in a flat plate, with no anterior-posterior differentiation.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: In a colony of 16 cells, four are in the center, and the other 12 are on the four sides, three each.
turn.8: A description by G.M. Smith (1920, p. 94): "Gonium" Mueller 1773: Colonies of 4-8-16 cells arranged in a flat quadrangular plate and embedded in a common gelatinous matrix or connected by broad gelatinous strands.
turn.10: Cells ovoid to pyriform, with a single cup-shaped chloroplast containing one pyrenoid.
turn.11: Is there anything else unique about it?
turn.12: Each cell with two cilia of equal length, contractile vacuoles at the base of the cilia, and an eyespot.
